intro: Hieracium magyaricum subsp. doroghense, commonly known as Hungarian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to orange flowers arranged in a composite head. The plant typically grows in dry meadows, grasslands, and rocky soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lanceolate, hairy, and have a serrated margin, while its stems are erect and often branched. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and morphological traits, making it a notable species in botanical studies.
